hotels.notes: Lovely hotel set back in a courtyard. Older but ornate rooms, classic parisian breakfast area.

Located in the Roma Norte neighborhood, the hotel wraps around a lush courtyard where the hotel has set-up their restaurant seating area. Comfortable and clean rooms, good service, and a good deal relative to most four seasons.

restaurants.notes: Incredible spot for lunch or dinner. Bustling at all times during the day. Amazing fresh fish that you put into tortillas to create tacos.
Located in the Condesa neighborhood. Fun atmosphere, nice interior, good wine and shareable dishes.

day.notes: Iconic market with tons of stalls selling textiles, trinkets, art, food, and more. In the Coyoacan neighborhood, a short walk away from the Frida Kahlo house. About a 35 minute uber from downtown in non-rush hour. Recommend making a morning of it.

restaurants.notes: Lovely french bistro in the west village. Highly recommend - salad maison (light, fresh, and perfectly dressed), scallops, gnocchi (best thing we had), saucisse puree (their go-to dish, sausage and mashed potatoes).

day.notes: Walk along the west-side of manhattan through Meatpacking and Chelsea on a raised walkway with lush landscaping and great views of the city.
